definition: to make an exhibition of oneself/to be a disgrace

sentences.chinese: 醉酒使得这位绅士丢人现眼。

sentences.english: And he felt ashamed in front of the little duchess.
sentences.chinese: 在小女公爵面前，他觉得丢人极了。

sentences.english: Zasa runs it like a disgrace, that’s what the women tell me.
sentences.chinese: 所有的女人都告诉我，Zasa的管理很丢人。

sentences.english: And look at our president. Its a shame on our country.
sentences.chinese: 再看看我们的总理，那简直是让国家丢人现眼。
醉葡萄酒使得此绅士丢人现眼。

sentences.english: Everyone disgraced abroad, but also to be tolerated by the law of the land.
sentences.chinese: 丢人丢到国外，自然也为国法所不容。

sentences.english: It is a shame to hitch up your trousers before the public.
sentences.chinese: 当着众人的面向上拉起裤子是丢人的行为。

sentences.english: This seems like the most backward thing, right?
sentences.chinese: 这似乎是最丢人的事情，对不？

sentences.english: And I basically feel this is the end of the world, this is humiliating and everybody notices.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得像世界末日一样，太丢人了，大家都看到了。

sentences.english: He wanted to put an end to a spectacle that impressed him as being indecent.
sentences.chinese: 他想结束让他感到丢人现眼的场面。

sentences.english: Such behavior will bring you into contempt.
sentences.chinese: 这样的行为会使你丢人现眼。

sentences.english: E. G. :In the beginning, Sanford Carter was ashamed of becoming an army cook.
sentences.chinese: 一开始，桑弗卡特觉得在部队里当炊事兵挺丢人的。
醉酒使得这位绅士丢人现眼。

sentences.english: It was a truly mortifying and disgusting experience.
sentences.chinese: 这是一次讨厌丢人的经历。

sentences.english: They had nothing to hide. They weren’t ashamed.
sentences.chinese: 没什么好遮掩的，他们不觉得丢人。

sentences.english: But the realy humiliation occurred after they arrived in America.
sentences.chinese: 而真正的丢人现眼还是到了美国之后。

definition: to make an exhibition of oneself/to be a disgrace
ashamed/embarrassed/not having the face (to meet people)/not daring (out of shame)
to embarrass oneself/to make a fool of oneself
to have no sense of shame/shameless
to have the nerve/what a cheek!/to feel no shame/to overcome the shame/(is it) proper? (rhetorical question)
ashamed and unable to show one's face
lit. for one's face to reach rock bottom/to be thoroughly discredited (idiom)
to look down upon/to hold in contempt
